simplesect.title: Detailed Description
simplesect.para: Any experienced C or C++ programmer knows the importance of header files. For those who do not, a header file allows multiple files to reference functions in other files without necessarily having to see the code (and therefore causing a multiple definition). To make a function in "opcontrol.c", "auto.c", "main.c", or any other C file visible to the core implementation files, prototype it here.
This file is included by default in the predefined stubs in each VEX Cortex PROS Project.

Purdue Robotics OS contains FreeRTOS (http://www.freertos.org) whose source code may be obtained from http://sourceforge.net/projects/freertos/files/ or on request.

literallayout.computeroutput: 1 44 #ifndef MAIN_H_ 45 46 // This prevents multiple inclusion, which isn't bad for this file but is good 47 // practice 48 #define MAIN_H_ 49 50 #include <API.h> 51 52 // Allow usage of this file in C++ programs 53 #ifdef __cplusplus 54 extern "C" { 55 #endif 56 57 //#define AUTO_DEBUG 58 59 // A function prototype looks exactly like its declaration, but with a semicolon 60 // instead of actual code. If a function does not match a prototype, compile 61 // errors will occur. 62 63 // Prototypes for initialization, operator control and autonomous 64 82 void autonomous(); 93 void initializeIO(); 107 void initialize(); 129 void operatorControl(); 130 131 // End C++ export structure 132 #ifdef __cplusplus 133 } 134 #endif 135 136 #endif
